verses.kjv: Hear ye this word which I take up against you, even a lamentation, O house of Israel.
verses.ct: Listen to this message that I am raising against you — a funeral song, people of Israel.

verses.kjv: The virgin of Israel is fallen; she shall no more rise: she is forsaken upon her land; there is none to raise her up.
verses.ct: Young Israel has collapsed; she will never get up again. She lies abandoned on her own soil, with no one to help her stand.

verses.kjv: For thus saith the Lord GOD; The city that went out by a thousand shall leave an hundred, and that which went forth by an hundred shall leave ten, to the house of Israel.
verses.ct: The Lord GOD says this: The city that sends out 1,000 soldiers will have only 100 return, and the one that sends out 100 will have only 10 come back to the people of Israel.

verses.kjv: For thus saith the LORD unto the house of Israel, Seek ye me, and ye shall live:
verses.ct: This is what the LORD says to the people of Israel: Turn to me, and you will survive.

verses.kjv: But seek not Bethel, nor enter into Gilgal, and pass not to Beersheba: for Gilgal shall surely go into captivity, and Bethel shall come to nought.
verses.ct: But don't go looking to Bethel, don't visit Gilgal, and don't travel to Beersheba — because Gilgal will certainly be taken into exile, and Bethel will be reduced to nothing.

verses.kjv: Seek the LORD, and ye shall live; lest he break out like fire in the house of Joseph, and devour it, and there be none to quench it in Bethel.
verses.ct: Turn to the LORD, and you will survive — otherwise he will sweep through the descendants of Joseph like a fire that consumes everything, with no one in Bethel able to put it out.

verses.kjv: Ye who turn judgment to wormwood, and leave off righteousness in the earth,
verses.ct: You are the ones who twist justice into something bitter and throw righteousness to the ground.

verses.kjv: Seek him that maketh the seven stars and Orion, and turneth the shadow of death into the morning, and maketh the day dark with night: that calleth for the waters of the sea, and poureth them out upon the face of the earth: The LORD is his name:
verses.ct: Seek the one who made the Pleiades and Orion, who transforms deep darkness into morning and turns daylight into night, who summons the ocean waters and pours them out over the surface of the earth — the LORD is his name.

verses.kjv: That strengtheneth the spoiled against the strong, so that the spoiled shall come against the fortress.
verses.ct: He brings sudden destruction on the powerful, and ruin crashes down on their fortified cities.

verses.kjv: They hate him that rebuketh in the gate, and they abhor him that speaketh uprightly.
verses.ct: They despise anyone who challenges them at the city court, and they detest anyone who speaks the truth.

verses.kjv: Forasmuch therefore as your treading is upon the poor, and ye take from him burdens of wheat: ye have built houses of hewn stone, but ye shall not dwell in them; ye have planted pleasant vineyards, but ye shall not drink wine of them.
verses.ct: Because you trample on the poor and extract grain taxes from them — you have built mansions of cut stone, but you will never live in them. You have planted beautiful vineyards, but you will never drink their wine.

verses.kjv: For I know your manifold transgressions and your mighty sins: they afflict the just, they take a bribe, and they turn aside the poor in the gate from their right.
verses.ct: I know how numerous your crimes are and how severe your sins. You oppress innocent people, you accept bribes, and you deny the poor their rights at the city court.

verses.kjv: Therefore the prudent shall keep silence in that time; for it is an evil time.
verses.ct: That is why anyone with sense stays quiet during times like these, because these are terrible times.

verses.kjv: Seek good, and not evil, that ye may live: and so the LORD, the God of hosts, shall be with you, as ye have spoken.
verses.ct: Pursue what is good instead of evil so that you may survive. Then the LORD, the God of Armies, will truly be with you, just as you claim he is.

verses.kjv: Hate the evil, and love the good, and establish judgment in the gate: it may be that the LORD God of hosts will be gracious unto the remnant of Joseph.
verses.ct: Reject evil and embrace what is good. Restore justice in the courts. Perhaps the LORD God of Armies will show mercy to what remains of Joseph's descendants.

verses.kjv: Therefore the LORD, the God of hosts, the LORD, saith thus; Wailing shall be in all streets; and they shall say in all the highways, Alas! alas! and they shall call the husbandman to mourning, and such as are skilful of lamentation to wailing.
verses.ct: So this is what the LORD, the God of Armies, the LORD himself declares: There will be crying in every street. In every public road people will shout in anguish. Farmers will be called to grieve, and professional mourners will be summoned to weep.

verses.kjv: And in all vineyards shall be wailing: for I will pass through thee, saith the LORD.
verses.ct: There will be wailing in every vineyard, because I will pass through your midst, says the LORD.

verses.kjv: Woe unto you that desire the day of the LORD! to what end is it for you? the day of the LORD is darkness, and not light.
verses.ct: How terrible it will be for you who long for the day of the LORD! Why would you want that day? The day of the LORD will bring darkness, not light.

verses.kjv: As if a man did flee from a lion, and a bear met him; or went into the house, and leaned his hand on the wall, and a serpent bit him.
verses.ct: It will be like someone running from a lion only to run into a bear, or going inside a house and resting a hand on the wall only to be bitten by a snake.

verses.kjv: Shall not the day of the LORD be darkness, and not light? even very dark, and no brightness in it?
verses.ct: Won't the day of the LORD bring darkness instead of light? Complete blackness without a single ray of brightness?

verses.kjv: I hate, I despise your feast days, and I will not smell in your solemn assemblies.
verses.ct: "I hate your religious festivals — I absolutely despise them. I take no pleasure in your sacred gatherings.

verses.kjv: Though ye offer me burnt offerings and your meat offerings, I will not accept them: neither will I regard the peace offerings of your fat beasts.
verses.ct: Even though you bring me burnt offerings and grain offerings, I will not accept them. I will not even look at the fellowship offerings of your fattened animals.

verses.kjv: Take thou away from me the noise of thy songs; for I will not hear the melody of thy viols.
verses.ct: Get your noisy songs away from me! I refuse to listen to the music of your harps.

verses.kjv: But let judgment run down as waters, and righteousness as a mighty stream.
verses.ct: Instead, let justice flow like a river, and righteousness like a never-ending stream.

verses.kjv: Have ye offered unto me sacrifices and offerings in the wilderness forty years, O house of Israel?
verses.ct: Did you bring me sacrifices and offerings during those 40 years in the wilderness, people of Israel?

verses.kjv: But ye have borne the tabernacle of your Moloch and Chiun your images, the star of your god, which ye made to yourselves.
verses.ct: No — instead you carried the shrine of your king Moloch and Chiun, the images of the star-god you made for yourselves.

verses.kjv: Therefore will I cause you to go into captivity beyond Damascus, saith the LORD, whose name is The God of hosts.
verses.ct: So I will send you into exile beyond Damascus," says the LORD, whose name is the God of Armies.
